concept.label: PlayStation VR game
concept.definition:
PlayStation VR game (noun):

A type of interactive digital entertainment or simulation that is specifically designed to be played on the PlayStation VR system, a virtual reality headset produced by Sony Interactive Entertainment. These games utilize VR technology to create immersive, 360-degree experiences, often requiring the player to use motion controls or a standard PlayStation controller to interact with the virtual environment.

data.description: "The Mofflys: Invasion Mayhem" is a named individual entity within the domain of PlayStation VR games. This information is derived from the list of PlayStation VR games on Wikipedia. The preferred label for this entity is "The Mofflys: Invasion Mayhem".
data.rationale: The assertion that "The Mofflys: Invasion Mayhem" is a PlayStation VR game can be supported by the information provided in the entity description. The description clearly states that "The Mofflys: Invasion Mayhem" is a named individual entity within the domain of PlayStation VR games. This information is derived from a reliable source, the list of PlayStation VR games on Wikipedia. Therefore, based on this information, it can be argued that "The Mofflys: Invasion Mayhem" is indeed a PlayStation VR game.

data.label: Gods (video game)
data.description: "Gods" is a 1991 video game developed in the United Kingdom by The Bitmap Brothers and published by Mindscape and Strategy First. It is a single-player platform game with action elements, set in antiquity and based on Greek mythology. The game was released on a wide array of computing platforms, including the Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Sega Genesis, Atari ST, Acorn Archimedes, MS-DOS, PC-9800 series, and Amiga. It was later remade and remastered onto other platforms such as WiiWare, Wii U, and Xbox One, and PlayStation VR. The game's score was composed by David Whittaker, Richard Joseph, and John Foxx. It is also known by various alternate titles, including "Gods Remastered", "GODS", "Tabletop Gods", "Gods vs. Humans", "Gods", "Animal Gods", "''Gods'' (video game)", and "Gods: Kami to naru Otoko no Densetsu".
data.rationale: The description of "Gods" (video game) states that it was later remade and remastered onto various platforms, including PlayStation VR. This indicates that the game was specifically designed to be played on the PlayStation VR system, which aligns with the definition of a PlayStation VR game. Therefore, it can be argued that "Gods" (video game) is a PlayStation VR game.

data.label: Doom (1993 video game)
data.description: "Doom" is a 1993 video game developed by id Software. It is a first-person shooter genre video game that has alternative versions and has been commercially released with DOSBox. The game has scored by Bobby Prince and has been published by both Atari, Inc. and id Software. The game was initially released on platforms such as the IOS, PlayStation 3, MS-DOS, Android, Linux, Xbox One, and many others. The game was also part of the Doom franchise series. Doom was not only a popular game but also considered an Internet phenomenon, becoming one of the most-played video games. The game set on Mars and in hell has a science fantasy theme and features demons. Doom also offered a multiplayer online game option and a level editor. The game is notable for its controversies and is known for being a censored video game. Despite this, it is considered artistic. Doom was released on many different dates, with the earliest release date being in 1993.
data.rationale: The provided description of Doom (1993 video game) does not include any information that would suggest it is a PlayStation VR game. The game was released on various platforms, including PlayStation 3, but there is no mention of it being specifically designed for or released on the PlayStation VR system. Therefore, based on the given information, it is not possible to argue that Doom (1993 video game) is a PlayStation VR game.

data.label: Esper Dream
data.description: Esper Dream is a Japan-exclusive video game developed and published by Konami. It is an action role-playing game that falls within the categories of Mobile game, Famicom Disk System game, and Konami game. The game, which revolves around psychic powers, was scored by Kinuyo Yamashita and was released on various platforms, including Mobile game, Virtual Console, Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo Entertainment System, and Famicom Disk System. The game was first released on February 20, 1987, with subsequent releases in 2007, 2013, and 2015. The game is also known as "Esper Dream II", "Esper", and "Esper Dream 2". It has also been made available for PlayStation VR and for the Virtual Console for Wii, Wii U, and Nintendo 3DS.
data.rationale: The description of Esper Dream states that it has been made available for PlayStation VR. Therefore, since Esper Dream is available on PlayStation VR, it can be argued that Esper Dream is a PlayStation VR game.

data.label: Eve Online
data.description: Eve Online is a cross-platform video game developed by CCP Games and introduced in 2003. It is a space-based massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) that supports cross-platform play and features a virtual economy. The game is also considered a space trading and combat simulator and a space flight simulation game, with elements of vehicular combat. Eve Online has been released on various platforms, including Windows and MacOS, and has been developed using Python software. The game is known for its science fiction universe, dystopian themes, and erotic elements. It has been published by THQ, Atari, and Simon & Schuster and is recognized for its expansion packs and being a business simulation video game. The game is also notable for its inclusion in the Museum of Modern Art's collection.
data.rationale: Based on the provided information, it cannot be argued that Eve Online is a PlayStation VR game. The description of Eve Online does not mention it being designed for or compatible with the PlayStation VR system. It is a cross-platform game that has been released on various platforms, including Windows and MacOS, but there is no mention of PlayStation VR. Therefore, using only the provided information, it cannot be asserted that Eve Online is a PlayStation VR game.

data.label: Kamen Rider Ex-Aid
data.description: "Kamen Rider Ex-Aid" is a television show and series based on video games, developed by Ishimori Productions and Toei Company, and created by Shotaro Ishinomori. This PlayStation VR game, also a Bandai Namco video game, was directed by Koichi Sakamoto and distributed by Toei Company. Notably, the series was aired on TV Asahi, and it features science fiction, action film, comedy drama, cyberpunk, superhero fiction, tokusatsu, and medical drama genres. The series, which was narrated by Junichi Suwabe, stars notable actors such as Ukyo Matsumoto, Shouma Kai, Tetsuya Iwanaga, Hayato Onozuka, Reina Kurosaki, and others. The show ran for 45 episodes from its release date on October 2, 2016, to its completion on August 27, 2017. It is a successor to the series "Kamen Rider Ghost" and was followed by "Kamen Rider Build". The series also has alternate titles including "Mighty Action X", "Masked Rider Ex Aid", and "Ultra Super Hero Taisen" among others.
data.rationale: The description of Kamen Rider Ex-Aid mentions that it is a PlayStation VR game developed by Bandai Namco. This aligns with the definition of a PlayStation VR game as an interactive digital entertainment or simulation designed to be played on the PlayStation VR system. Therefore, based on the provided information, it can be argued that Kamen Rider Ex-Aid is a PlayStation VR game.

data.description: "Kid Icarus" is a side-scrolling platform game, which is also a part of the Classic NES Series. The game was first released in 1986 and has been made available on various platforms over the years, including the Game Boy Advance, Wii's Virtual Console, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U's Virtual Console, and Nintendo Switch Online. The game is known for its shapeshifting features and is a part of the larger "Kid Icarus" series. It was composed by Hirokazu Tanaka and produced by Gunpei Yokoi. The game has been recognized as one of the best-selling Nintendo Entertainment System video games. Alternative titles for the game include "Hikari Shinwa: Palutena no Kamigami" and "3D Classics: Kid Icarus", among others.
data.rationale: Based on the provided information, there is no evidence to suggest that Kid Icarus is a PlayStation VR game. The game was developed by Nintendo and has been released on various Nintendo platforms, but there is no mention of it being available on the PlayStation VR system. Therefore, it cannot be argued that Kid Icarus is a PlayStation VR game.

data.label: NES Open Tournament Golf

data.label: Clu Clu Land
